verses.kjv: And there was given me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel stood, saying, Rise, and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and them that worship therein.
verses.ct: Then I was given a measuring reed shaped like a staff, and the angel stood and said, "Get up and measure God's temple, the altar, and count those who worship there."

verses.kjv: But the court which is without the temple leave out, and measure it not; for it is given unto the Gentiles: and the holy city shall they tread under foot forty and two months.
verses.ct: "But skip the outer courtyard — don't measure it, because it has been handed over to the Gentiles. They will trample the holy city for 42 months."

verses.kjv: And I will give power unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred and threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.
verses.ct: "I will empower my 2 witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days, dressed in sackcloth."

verses.kjv: These are the two olive trees, and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth.
verses.ct: These are the 2 olive trees and the 2 lampstands that stand in the presence of the God of the earth.

verses.kjv: And if any man will hurt them, fire proceedeth out of their mouth, and devoureth their enemies: and if any man will hurt them, he must in this manner be killed.
verses.ct: If anyone tries to harm them, fire comes from their mouths and consumes their enemies. Anyone who attempts to hurt them will be killed in this way.

verses.kjv: These have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the days of their prophecy: and have power over waters to turn them to blood, and to smite the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.
verses.ct: They have the authority to shut up heaven so that no rain falls during the time of their prophecy. They also have authority over the waters to turn them into blood and to strike the earth with every kind of plague as often as they choose.

verses.kjv: And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them, and shall overcome them, and kill them.
verses.ct: When they have completed their testimony, the beast that rises from the bottomless pit will wage war against them, defeat them, and kill them.

verses.kjv: And their dead bodies shall lie in the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.
verses.ct: Their corpses will lie in the street of the great city — the one symbolically called Sodom and Egypt — where their Lord was also crucified.

verses.kjv: And they of the people and kindreds and tongues and nations shall see their dead bodies three days and an half, and shall not suffer their dead bodies to be put in graves.
verses.ct: People from every nation, tribe, language, and ethnic group will stare at their corpses for 3 and a half days, refusing to let them be buried.

verses.kjv: And they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoice over them, and make merry, and shall send gifts one to another; because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt on the earth.
verses.ct: Those living on the earth will celebrate over them and throw parties and exchange gifts with each other, because these 2 prophets had brought such torment to the people of the earth.

verses.kjv: And after three days and an half the Spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them which saw them.
verses.ct: But after 3 and a half days, the spirit of life from God entered them, and they stood up on their feet. Everyone who saw it was struck with absolute terror.

verses.kjv: And they heard a great voice from heaven saying unto them, Come up hither. And they ascended up to heaven in a cloud; and their enemies beheld them.
verses.ct: Then they heard a loud voice from heaven telling them, "Come up here!" So they went up into heaven in a cloud while their enemies watched.

verses.kjv: And the same hour was there a great earthquake, and the tenth part of the city fell, and in the earthquake were slain of men seven thousand: and the remnant were affrighted, and gave glory to the God of heaven.
verses.ct: At that very moment a massive earthquake struck, and a 10th of the city collapsed. 7,000 people were killed in the earthquake, and the survivors were terrified and gave glory to the God of heaven.

verses.kjv: The second woe is past; and, behold, the third woe cometh quickly.
verses.ct: The 2nd disaster has passed, but pay attention — the 3rd disaster is coming soon.

verses.kjv: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of this world are become the kingdoms of our Lord, and of his Christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.
verses.ct: Then the 7th angel blew his trumpet, and loud voices rang out in heaven, declaring, "The kingdoms of this world have now become the kingdom of our Lord and of his Christ, and he will reign forever and ever!"

verses.kjv: And the four and twenty elders, which sat before God on their seats, fell upon their faces, and worshipped God,
verses.ct: The 24 elders who were seated on their thrones in God's presence fell on their faces and worshiped God,

verses.kjv: Saying, We give thee thanks, O LORD God Almighty, which art, and wast, and art to come; because thou hast taken to thee thy great power, and hast reigned.
verses.ct: saying, "We thank you, Lord God, the Almighty, who is and who was and who is coming, because you have taken up your great power and begun to reign."

verses.kjv: And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.
verses.ct: "The nations raged, but your wrath has arrived. The time has come for the dead to be judged, for you to reward your servants the prophets, the saints, and all who deeply revere your name — both insignificant and important — and to destroy those who are destroying the earth."

verses.kjv: And the temple of God was opened in heaven, and there was seen in his temple the ark of his testament: and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.
verses.ct: Then God's temple in heaven was opened, and the ark of his covenant could be seen inside the temple. Lightning flashed, voices roared, thunder crashed, an earthquake shook the ground, and enormous hail fell.
